bibl.title: Forme e contenitori di incenso nei papiri.
bibl.note: Papyrological evidence underlines the granular consistence of the frankincense which circulated on the Egyptian market in the form of βῶλοι (lumps), πλάσματα (cakes) or κολλύρια (pellets), as well as in sealed pouches. The rare word λιβανοθήκη might point to a Christian context for P. Oxy. VI, 978 (IIIrd cent.). - Avec résumés en italien et en anglais.

bibl.title: Papyrotheke. Rivista online di Papirologie dell'Università di Parma

bibl.seg: Isabella Bonati, Forme e contenitori di incenso nei papiri.
Papyrotheke. Rivista online di Papirologie dell'Università di Parma 1 (2010) pp. 45-56.

Papyrological evidence underlines the granular consistence of the frankincense which circulated on the Egyptian market in the form of βῶλοι (lumps), πλάσματα (cakes) or κολλύρια (pellets), as well as in sealed pouches. The rare word λιβανοθήκη might point to a Christian context for P. Oxy. VI, 978 (IIIrd cent.). - Avec résumés en italien et en anglais.
